title: Public transport for the NRL Round 14 – Melbourne Storm v Newcastle Knights
articleContent:
NRL is back at AAMI Park. This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Storm takes on the Newcastle Knights. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Sunday 9 June.

The event will begin at 2pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

We're running extra services from Richmond Station after the match.

Towards Glen Waverley
  • leaving at 4:22pm from Platform 10
Towards Sandringham 
  • leaving at 4:14pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park:

Route 70
  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the Route 246 bus close to AAMI Park.

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

Plan your journey

Set your location to plan your journey to and from AAMI Park.
